intro: Boehmeria cypholophoides, commonly known as the woolly flaxleaf, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its fibrous stems have been historically used for making textiles and paper.
